title: Houthis vow retaliation for U.S.-U.K. strikes; regional conflict feared
description: The Yemen-based militants have been harassing international shipping in protest of Israel’s U.S.-backed war on Hamas in Gaza. The allies’ strikes on more than 60 targets increased fears of a spreading regional conflagration.

title: Paris mint melts 27 million coins after E.U. said stars were hard to read
description: The mint hadn’t sought required approval for a new design. Fixing it could cost more than 1 million euros.

title: Israel rejects genocide allegations at international court
description: The Israeli delegation accused South Africa of presenting a “grossly distorted” picture by largely ignoring the role of Hamas in the fighting and of politicizing the Genocide Convention.

title: Who is Denmark’s Crown Prince Frederik? From party prince to Danish king.
description: Denmark’s new king has a tough act to follow from his popular mother, but his Australian-born has won the people’s hearts and he’s warming to the task.

title: ‘Anti-pope.’ ‘Blasphemous.’ Criticism of Francis comes in strident terms.
description: The number of clerics loudly and proudly announcing their intent to disregard the pope grew after Francis approved blessings for same-sex couples.

title: How the Biden administration helped avoid a coup in Guatemala
description: Guatemala’s Bernardo Arevalo has reached Inauguration Day with the help of U.S. diplomats working largely behind the scenes.

title: Crew of crashed U.N. helicopter waited an hour for rescue before kidnap
description: The U.N. helicopter was on its way to evacuate wounded people from the Somali town of Wisil when it crash-landed Wednesday in an area controlled by the al-Shabab militant group.

title: British prime minister, in Kyiv, showcases security pact with Ukraine
description: On a visit to the Ukrainian capital, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak also announced billions in new military assistance, including for ramped-up drone production.

title: Seeking cash, Hamas turns to allies experienced in ‘financial jihad’
description: The Gaza conflict has re-energized old fundraising networks with ties to militant Islamist groups and causes, including groups accused of raising money in the past for al-Qaeda, current and former U.S. counterterrorism officials say.

title: List of most powerful and weakest passports highlights global disparities
description: The global mobility gap for visa-free travel is “wider than ever,” according to the Passport Index. Japan, Singapore, France, Germany, Italy and Spain share the top spot.

title: Israel-Gaza war live updates: Houthi official warns of ‘dire consequences’ after U.S., U.K. strikes in Yemen
description: Israel will present its defense to South Africa’s accusations that Israel committed genocide in Gaza, at the International Court of Justice in The Hague on Friday.

title: China looms over Taiwan’s fateful election
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping ’s coercive measures and saber rattling have contributed to a hardening rift between China and Taiwan.

title: U.S. failed to track $1 billion in Ukraine military aid, watchdog says
description: The Pentagon inspector general’s findings come as President Biden has urged Congress to pass a massive package of additional military aid for Ukraine.

title: U.S.-led coalition strikes Iran-aligned Houthi militants in Yemen
description: The strike in Yemen follows a surge in Houthi attacks on commercial ships in the Red Sea that have wreaked havoc on the global economy.
